function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Blurring lines between work and home life could lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases within households.","Impact":"Unmitigated transmission of contagious diseases at home could lead to prolonged illness, spread to vulnerable individuals, and strain on healthcare systems.","Mitigation":"Establishing clear guidelines for hygiene and sanitation in multipurpose homes, promoting vaccination, and providing remote healthcare services.","Technologies":"Smart home technologies for air quality monitoring, contactless controls, and remote health monitoring.","People":"Residential occupants, particularly those living in multipurpose homes.","Owner":"Homeowners, property managers, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Technology-facilitated real-time residential management could lead to increased exposure to contagious diseases if not implemented with appropriate health and safety protocols.","Impact":"Unregulated use of technology for residential management could contribute to the spread of contagious diseases through shared facilities and common areas.","Mitigation":"Implementing health and safety protocols for technology use, providing virtual alternatives for in-person services, and promoting touchless technologies.","Technologies":"Smart building management systems, touchless entry systems, and virtual communication platforms.","People":"Residents, property managers, and maintenance staff of managed rental properties.","Owner":"Property management companies, technology providers, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Shift in homebuyer preferences and housing locations due to COVID-19 could lead to spread of contagious diseases in new residential areas.","Impact":"Unplanned migration and population shifts could lead to overcrowding, strain on local healthcare, and increased transmission of contagious diseases in new residential areas.","Mitigation":"Urban planning for sustainable development, healthcare infrastructure investment, and public health education for new residents.","Technologies":"Urban planning software, healthcare facility design tools, and virtual public health education platforms.","People":"New residents in exurbs and suburbs, local authorities, and urban planners.","Owner":"Local government, public health authorities, and urban planning organizations."}]}
